channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [JCRVLT-386] Eclipse/m2e: Could not get metadata for dependencies which are resolved via m2e workspace resolution or for multimodule builds with phases < package
item.description:
One could get the following error in Eclipse with m2e

Could not get meta information for dependencies 'Dependency{group='null', groupId='<some group id>', name='null', 
 artifactId='<some artifact id>', version='null'}': <project-directory>/target/classes (Is a directory) (org.apache.jackrabbit:filevault-package-maven-plugin:1.0.5-SNAPSHOT:validate-files:default-
 validate-files:process-classes) org.apache.maven.plugin.MojoExecutionException: Could not get meta information for dependencies 'Dependency{group='null', groupId='<some group id>', name='null', 
 artifactId='<some artifact id>', version='null'}': <project-directory>/target/classes (Is a directory) at

 org.eclipse.core.internal.events.BuildManager$1.run(BuildManager.java:316) at

item.summary: Eclipse/m2e: Could not get metadata for dependencies which are resolved via m2e workspace resolution or for multimodule builds with phases < package

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: This is very similar to the issue JCRVLT-331. This is related to workspace resolution in m2e which might return the classes folder for workspace dependencies.
Fixed with http://svn.apache.org/r1868557 and http://svn.apache.org/r1868562.
